This is the start of a project to collate an enormous list of all sorts of random tasks!
You can use this list however you like- perhaps to assign yourself or your sub tasks, or inspire your next lock.

Everyone is encouraged to add their own ideas as they wish, subject to these rules:
Number each of your tasks, following on from the last task posted.Tasks can‚Äôt reference specific people by name. You can identify people by role, such as ‚Äòyour keyholder‚Äô, ‚Äòanother sub‚Äô, and so on.More specific, interesting, memorable tasks are better. Weirder is better. There will be a LOT of tasks over time! (For example, ‚Äò10 minutes cornertime‚Äô is a bit dull, but how about ‚Äòcornertime until you flawlessly recite ‚Äòbaa baa black sheep‚Äô backwards‚Äô?)Don‚Äôt worry about making a task that everyone can do. Some people don‚Äôt have specific toys, or even a keyholder- that‚Äôs fine, they can do another task. Everyone has very different limits, so a task that isn't a limit for someone is likely a very boring task!Try to avoid multi-stage tasks by breaking them into multiple entries instead. E.g., instead of ‚Äòflip a coin, on heads X, on tails Y‚Äô, add X and Y to the list separately.Skim the list first, to make sure your idea (or something similar) isn't on it already.I‚Äôm not yucking anyone‚Äôs yums, but I want this list to be as easily usable as possible by people who are struggling to find tasks here. As such, please don‚Äôt include any of the following kinks:RL kink/sex hookupsScatReally extreme public humiliation (‚Äúlife ruining‚Äù stuff)Anything that causes permanent damage
Other than that, go wild! You can write up everything you‚Äôve done in one big post, or just add random ideas one at a time as they come to mind.

Finally, note that this isn‚Äôt an ‚Äúofficial‚Äù list of ‚Äúapproved‚Äù tasks or anything, just another community resource. As always, play safe, and exercise your best judgement when anyone asks you to perform any task- not just ones from this list! (edited)

Rolling a task using Dyno is hard, as you can't specify an arbitrary dice size. But you can roll d10s, in sequence, equal to the number of digits, to get a balanced random number. You can use a smaller dice for the first digit if there's fewer tasks (d2, d4, d6, d8) to save time. You will need to subtract 1 from the result in this instance.

For example, presume there are 25 tasks, and I want to roll a random one.
I start by rolling a d4, and get a 4. 4 minus 1 is 3, and there aren't any tasks from 30 to 39 yet, so I start again.

I roll a d4 again. This time I get a 3. 3 minus 1 is 2. There are some tasks starting with 2, so I continue.
I roll a d10, and get a 7. 2 & 7- task number 27! Unfortunately, there's no such task. I start again.

I roll a d4. I get a 1. 1 minus 1 is 0, so my task will be from 00 (another reroll) to 09.
I roll a d10, and get a 1. That's 0 & 1- task number 1. Time to drink some water!
